missionProperties.campaignName: The Grand Inquisitor (Sith Loyalist) Villain Pack

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.name: Crate1
entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 2
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.name: Crate2
entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
You manage to reach the safehouse a few hours before the Imperials arrive.

{-} The heroes deploy to any interior space.
{-} Doors are locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.

eventActions.theText: {-} Imperial figures attack doors if this is the quickest way to their target.
The refugees you managed to get to the safehouse are tired, exhausted, and frightened.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Tassi
entityProperties.theText:
Tassi Gol'berat, a young Balosar thief, is trying to hide behind the conveyor belt, covering her head with her arms.

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Camsir
entityProperties.theText:
Camsir, a young Duros boy, is cowering behind the shelf as his mother desperately whispers to him to stay quiet.

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Dumudu
entityProperties.theText:
Dumudu, a Duros woman, is trying to calm down her panicking son.

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Sheedro
entityProperties.theText:
Sheedro Volanir, a Chalactan carpenter, is trying to hide in the safehouse's workshop.

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent refugees. Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.

Your pilot warns you that he has picked up the signature of an Inquisitor's TIE. This is going to be tough, but maybe you can hold out long enough.

{-} The Rebels win at the end of Round 5.
{-} The Rebels lose when all refugees are defeated, or when all heroes are wounded.

{-} Doors are locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent refugees. Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.
{-} The Rebels win at the end of Round 5.
{-} The Rebels lose when all refugees are defeated, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
You manage to hold off the Imperials until reinforcements arrive. Y-Wings strafe the area, blasting the Imperial forces into retreat. The surviving refugees are safe thanks to your hard work.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Heroes receive 50 credits per hero for each refugee remaining.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
Cornered and out of options, you fight with desperation and just barely manage to escape. After receiving an extraction, your pilot warns you that his sensors are still picking up the Grand Inquisitor's TIE, hot on your trail.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} The Empire receives <color="red">The Grand Inquisitor</color> (Sith Loyalist) as a villain.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Destroy Door 1
globalEvents.eventText: Under the Imperial onslaught the door is finally blown to pieces.

entityProperties.name: Door 1
entityProperties.theText:
The blast door is keeping the refugees safe - for now.

{-} The door is locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.

globalEvents.name: Reveal Tassi Force
globalEvents.eventText:
Tassi screams, stumbles back and raises her hands to fend off the attack - which is suddenly stopped in mid-air. Tassi's antennae twitch in surprise as she stares at her own hands.

{-} Flip Tassi's token to the colored side. Tassi is the Force-sensitive refugee.
{-} While defending, the Force-sensitive refugee adds 1 white die to the defense pool.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Tassi
entityProperties.theText:
Tassi Gol'berat, a young Balosar thief, is trying to hide behind the conveyor belt, covering her head with her arms.

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). While defending, Tassi adds 1 white die to her defense pool.
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.

eventActions.theText:
"That's the one!", an officer shouts, and the Imperials surge forward.

{-} The two Imperial figures with the highest figure cost move 3 toward the Force-sensitive refugee.

{-} Doors are locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent refugees. Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.
{-} While defending, the Force-sensitive refugee adds 1 white die to the defense pool.
{-} The Rebels win at the end of Round 5.
{-} The Rebels lose when all refugees are defeated, or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Reveal Tassi Regular
globalEvents.eventText: Tassi screams and stumbles back as the attack hits her.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Tassi
entityProperties.theText:

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). 
{-} When a refugee would suffer {H}, each healthy hero adjacent to that refugee tests {J}. Each hero that succeeds reduces the amount of {H} by 1 for each of his activation tokens.

globalEvents.name: Reveal Camsir Force
globalEvents.eventText:
Camsir cowers in fear, and suddenly items from the shelves come raining down on the Imperials, throwing off their aim. The Duros child's eyes are huge as he watches in awe.

{-} Flip Camsir's token to the colored side. Camsir is the Force-sensitive refugee.
{-} While defending, the Force-sensitive refugee adds 1 white die to the defense pool.

globalEvents.name: Defeat Tassi
globalEvents.eventText: Tassi finally collapses under the attacks.

entityProperties.theText:

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".

globalEvents.name: Defeat Camsir
globalEvents.eventText: Camsir tries to seek shelter under the shelves, which soon collapse, burying him.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Camsir
entityProperties.theText:

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".

globalEvents.name: Defeat Dumudu
globalEvents.eventText: Dumudu throws herself at the Imperials in a final act of defiance, but is soon shot down.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Dumudu
entityProperties.theText:
Dumudu, a Duros woman, is trying to calm down her panicking son.

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".

globalEvents.name: Defeat Sheedro
globalEvents.eventText: His back against the wall, Sheedro holds up his hands to signal his surrender, but the Imperials show no mercy.

entityProperties.name: Refugee Sheedro
entityProperties.theText:
Sheedro Volanir, a Chalactan carpenter, is trying to hide in the safehouse's workshop.

{-} Imperial figures can attack refugees (Health: 5, Defense: 1 {G}). The first time a refugee suffers {H} or is declared as the target of an attack, click "Reveal".

globalEvents.name: Reveal Dumudu Force
globalEvents.eventText:
Dumudu trembles as the attacks rain down upon her, then she closes her big eyes. One of the Imperial soldiers stumbles back and drops his weapon, then looks around in confusion.

{-} Flip Dumudu's token to the colored side. Dumudu is the Force-sensitive refugee.
{-} While defending, the Force-sensitive refugee adds 1 white die to the defense pool.

globalEvents.name: Reveal Sheedro Force
globalEvents.eventText:
Sheedro's eyes grow wide, then his hand suddenly shoots forward, and one of the Imperials is thrown back by an invisible power.

{-} Flip Sheedro's token to the colored side. Sheedro is the Force-sensitive refugee.
{-} While defending, the Force-sensitive refugee adds 1 white die to the defense pool.

globalEvents.name: The Grand Inquisitor
globalEvents.eventText: A crimson lightsaber blade shears through the wall. In the opening stands an ominous figure in black armor. "Why, hello there." The Grand Inquisitor smiles with pointed teeth. "Ready to die?"
